result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Homicide by Negligent Operation/Vehicle, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.10(1).
  • Reckless Driving-Cause Great Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.62(4).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay the balance of all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges and provide a DNA sample (unless previously done) and pay DNA surcharge-to be paid over period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment;
**Court ordered restitution set at ZERO

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never possess a firearm or body armor and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

-Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision;
-Cooperate and participate with a mental health evaluation and follow any recommended treatment;

-Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment;
-Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens

timeConds.notes:
12-06-2016/ Judge Jeffrey Conen
The Court ordered that the defendant, Charles Jones, shall be allowed to leave the Milwaukee County House of Correction, Huber Section, on Thursday, December 8, 2016, commencing at 8:00 a.m. and shall be authorized to travel to Froedert Hospital for the purpose of visiting with his mother within the confines of the Hospital; and the defendant shall return to the Milwaukee County House of Correction, Huber Section, at or before 8:00 p.m. on Thursday, December 8, 2016.



Stayed until 06-07-2016 at 12:00 pm.    06-20-16: JOC Corrected to include release privileges for medical appointments, treatment and therapy.

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that the petition for return of property, to wit:  2002 Gold Buick LeSabre car and one cell phone is hereby denied pursuant to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 968.20.  Therefore, the above-titled matter is dismissed without prejudice.

Corporation Counsel, Jennifer Rhodes, appeared on behalf of the State of Wisconsin.  No other appearances.

Matter in court for Return of Property Hearing.
Petitioner Delanda J., does not appear.
The property owner/defendant, Charles Jones, was not produced.
Statements made.

Court ordered petition for return of property dismissed without prejudice for failure to prosecute.

**Court signed the proposed order today.
Return of property hearing on August 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Milw Co Sheriff Inventory # 14-001842/14-001735(PHONE/VEHICLE).
from Delanda Jones dated 8/15/16, received and filed.
JOC Corrected to include release privileges for medical appointments, treatment and therapy.
Associated with Charge #2
Associated with Charge #1
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form; filed.
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; filed.

**MATTER HEARD BY JUDGE CONEN FOR JUDGE DONALD.....
Defendant Charles Jones in court with attorney Dennis P Coffey.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Sentencing proceeds. No changes made to the "Private" PSI.  Statements made by the State, defense and defendant. Additional statements made by victim's sister, Melanie R.; deceased victim's sister, Curreen B.; deceased victim's wife, Christine M.; and defendant's wife, Delanda J.
 
AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 6 YEARS, consecutive to Count #2.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS.
Credit given for 4 days time served.

AS TO COUNT 2:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 2 YEARS, consecutive to Count #1.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEAR.
Credit given for ZERO days time served.

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2:  COURT STAYS sentences and places defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS under the supervision of the Wisconsin Department of Corrections.

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2):
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* AS TO COUNT 1 ONLY:  SERVE 1 YEAR "condition time" at the House of Correction under the supervision of Wisconsin Department of Corrections - stayed until 06-07-2016 at 12:00 PM.  Court allows release privileges for medical appointments, treatment, and therapy.
* Perform 300 hours of community service.
* Cooperate and participate with a mental health evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* Provide a DNA sample (unless previously done) and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court ordered restitution set at ZERO.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Filed:

Defendant Charles Jones in court with attorney Dennis P Coffey.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Dennis Coffey appeared before the clerk in person.  ADA Grant Huebner appeared TELEPHONICALLY.

Defense requests to adjourn tomorrow's Sentencing Hearing.
Defense's private PSI is not yet completed.
State does not object to the request for an adjournment.

Case adjourned to 05-06-2016 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Sentencing Hearing.

Defendant Charles Jones in court with attorney Dennis P Coffey.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Case adjourned to 04-07-2016 at 3:00 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Sentencing Hearing.

**Conditions of bail remain the same.
